poem:
Title: "The Open Wallets"

Under the weight of 
Gold, the Party beasts bow,
Their bellies roar with millions,
Amidst the colour of Conservatives, Labour.

Rich fruits fall from the
towers, but do they feed
the soil below?

A generosity, undeniable,
But forged in the furnace of desire.
Aspirations tailored, voices honed,
But whose song do they really echo?

The feast is amassing,
Yet the many dine not.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Who are the big Conservative and Labour donors? The Conservatives and Labour have amassed huge war chests for the election, funded by the rise of megadonors giving millions of pounds as individuals or through their companies. Over the past year, the Tories have significantly outdone Labour, bringing in £44m, while Labour have drawn £24.6m – excluding public funds. However, in the first quarter of this year, the fundraising was more evenly matched. The Conservatives brought". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
